intro: Parathesis vulgata, commonly known as the common parathesis, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring season. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Parathesis vulgata is often found in meadows and along woodland edges.
